14-00000

SECRET

21 MAY 1976

MORANDUM FOR THE RECORD

SUBJECT: PANAMANIAN REPRESSIVE MEASURES AGAINST CUBAN EXILES

REF: HZPA-21247, 21 April 1976

1. All names in ref dispatch were traced, as much as possible, and interested desks were notified of Subject's past or present ops interests.

2. Following is the information retrieved from the traces:

A. GARCIA Vasquez, Orlando. (WKTANGO-1) Notified the Venezuelan Desk, they in turn will notify the field.

B. HUERTAS, Enrique (Medical Doctor) (201-279389) - AMUNG-2. After more than five years of service as a JMWAVE psychological warfare agent A-2 was amicably terminated on 30 November 1965.

C. PEREZ Alamo, Duney (201-0334081) alias Capt. Alamo, AMLUNT-2. Recruited Dec 65 for use as MHARRON recruiter. He received agent and team training which included demolition. Subject was terminated 31 Dec 66 due to inability to establish operational contacts.

D. MORALES Navarrete, Ricardo. Resides in Venezuela, no ops interest.

E. PUENTE Blanco, Jose (201-163893). Was of interest to Caracas Station, informed the desk.

F. PUENTE Blanco, Roberto (201-126313). CIFENCE-7. Was of interest to Caracas Station, informed the desk.

G. BUSTILLOS, Antonio. Possibly Subject of 201-756656, AMWAX-2. Recruited in 1964 and terminated November 1966. Reason was cancellation of Operation SAMSON and economy in operations.

H. MARTINEZ Castro, Pedro (201-346051), No ops interest.

I. ESTEVEZ, Angel (201-732176). No ops interest.

J. JIMENEZ, Caspar. No 201.

SECRET
201-334081

--- Page 3 ---

14-00000

SECRET

K. VASQUEZ, Jose AKA “Pepe”. Not identified.

L. MILERA, Raul de la. No 201.

M. FONT, Ramon. Not identified.

N. LORENZO, Carlos. Not identified.

O. GARCIA, Rigoberto. Possibly Subject of 201-319634, SLAPJACK-30. Was initially contacted Jan/Feb 1962. On OA was granted 7 Jan 74 for SLAPJACK-30's use as a radio operator for project SLAPJACK, Could not find any indication that Subject has been terminated.

P. HERNANDEZ, Carlos. Not identified.

Q. MIRON, Jose. No 201.

R. BERDAGUER, Guillermo AKA VERDAGUER. (201-231514) No ops interest.

S. CALATAYUD, Antonio. Possibly Subject of 201-297795. OA was requested 31 Mar 61 for use as a PM trainee. File docs not indicate if OA given or if he was ever used.

T. ALONSO, Marcos. No traces.

3. LA/COG has been notified of the inclusion of former COG assets on this list and will take whatever action is deemed appropriate. The Venezuelan desk is taking action in the cases of GARCIA and PUENTE.

Juan Ortiz
LA/PNC/PA

DISTRIBUTION:
Orig. - S6-5-21 w/cy of dispatch
1 - LA/COG w/cy of dispatch
1 - LA/PNC/V w/cy of dispatch
1 - chrono

SECRET

--- Page 4 ---

14-00000

INFO.
DISPATCH

Chief, Latin America Division

SECRET

IN FIELD
DENGESTED
IN INDEXING
ERTURE CARD REQUESTED
FROM
Chief of Station, Panama City
SUBJECT: Panamanian Repressive Measures against Cuban Exiles

ACTION REQUIRED REFERENCES
ACTION: See para 5.

1. A compilation of information reported by Station penetrations of the local service (i.e. HYEPOCH-5, HYEPOCH-11, HYRAVEN-11) indicates that the local security service is assuming an increasingly hostile posture against Cuban exiles traveling to Panama. The reporting sources coincide in their information that this attitude is directed primarily against Cuban exiles residing in Miami. It appears that this development may be the result of the reporting of HYGRUFF-1's agent in Miami, Salvador ALDAREGUIA. ALDAREGUIA continues to report from Miami alleging cooperation between Cuban exiles and Panamanian exiles in Miami who are opposed to the regime of General Omar TORRIJOS Herrera.

2. HYGRUFF-1 recently submitted a watchlist of Cuban exiles to Tocumen International Airport (TIA) and other Panamanian ports of entry ordering the recipients to deny entry into Panama to all those persons on the watchlist. HYEPOCH-5, the most alert of all Station penetrations commented that in his opinion the list contained Cuban Embassy input because his service did not have the capability to collect sufficient data on all the persons listed to be able to make a meaningful evaluation of which ones are dangerous. The Station has not been able to confirm HYEPOCH-5's suspicions.

3. For the record, the Cuban exiles on HYGRUFF-1's watchlist are the following:

(continued)

Distribution:
2 - C/LAD
1 - E2 IMPDET
CROSS REFERENCE TO
DISPATCH SYMBOL AND NUMBER
HZPA-21247
DATE
21 April 1976
CLASSIFICATION

CONTINUATION OF

SECRET

HZPA-21247

a. GARCIA Vasquez, Orlando. Resides in Venezuela.

b. HUERTAS, Enrique (Medical Doctor). AMUNG-2

c. PEREZ Alamo, Duney, alias Capt. Alamo

d. MORALES Navarrete, Ricardo. Resides in Venezuela.

e. PUENTE Blanco, Jose. 201-0163893

f. PUENTE Blanco, Roberto. CIFENCE-7 201-0126313

g. BUSTILLOS, Antonio. Possible 201-0756656

h. MARTINEZ Castro, Pedro. 201-0346051 - no ops int.

i. ESTEVEZ, Angel. He is well known to Floyd H. McNertney (NOC). He is a criminal. no ops int.

j. JIMENEZ, Gaspar

k. VASQUEZ, Jose, aka "Pepe". no ident.

l. MILERA, Raul de la. no ident.

m. FONT, Ramon. no ident.

n. LORENZO, Carlos. no ident.

o. GARCIA, Rigoberto. Possible SLAPJACK-30 201-0319634

p. HERNANDEZ, Carlos alias "El Aura". no ident.

q. MIRON, Jose.

r. BERDAGUER, Guillermo aka VERDAGUER. 201-0231514

s. CALATAYUD, Antonio. McNertney thinks the last name is a garble.

t. ALONSO, Marcos.

4. Of the persons listed above, MCNERTNEY knows Orlando GARCIA Vasquez well. GARCIA was born in Cuba, became a naturalized U.S. citizen when he fled from Cuba to the United States. He eventually settled in Venezuela where he became a close friend and confidant of Carlos Andres PEREZ, now president of Venezuela. Aside from Venezuelan diplomatic posts he has held abroad he was at one time Chief of Operations of DIGEFOL. MCNERTNEY commented that if the Panamanians ever had the temerity to mistreat GARCIA that PEREZ' reaction against TORRIJOS would undoubtedly be fierce.

5. We defer to Headquarters to name check these individuals, ascertain if BKHERALD has any operational interest in any of them, and advise the responsible component to take precautionary measures in the event any movement of these individuals involves travel to or transiting Panama. In exploiting this information please protect the sources.

Algernon, O. FORTYUNE

FORM 53a
CLASSIFICATION
SECRET

1. HQS TRACES ON DUNNEY PIO PEREZ ALAMO (201-334081):
PEREZ RECRUITED DEC 65 FOR USE AS MHAPRON RECRUITER. HE RECEIVED
AGENT AND TEAM TRAINING WHICH INCLUDED DEMOLITION. PEREZ WAS
TERMINATED 31 DEC 66 DUE TO INABILITY TO ESTABLISH LOCATION OF
OPERATIONAL CONTACTS.
